speaker: Female Elf

lines: They-- [laughs] The silhouette shrugs. [sheepish sounds] Um, Edward says,

speaker: Edward
lines: Question one. Magnus, what is your ideal first date?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Oh, gosh. Uh... let's see. I would say, I pick them up, you know, roundabout sundown, uh, and then we– catch fireflies. And then I take them home, and we don't see each other again, ‘cause I'm really not interested in dating.

speaker: Griffin
lines: The studio audience from behind these bright lights, you hear them go,

speaker: Audience
lines: [exaggerated] Ooooooooooh! [cheers]

speaker: Griffin
lines: The silhouette is like, fanning itself. Lydia says,

speaker: Lydia
lines: Playing hard to get, huh? It seems like our contestant is into that. Merle, same question. What's your ideal first date?

speaker: Merle
lines: Alright, I let her pick me up. I mention to her that I- 'Uh, gosh I forgot my wallet at home,' even though we're in like the front yard.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And uh- That's the- That's the audience! The audience gets a good chuckle [background laughter track] out of that, and they are fucking loving Merle.

speaker: Merle
lines: I volunteer to drive her vehicle, and tell her it's filthy, and so we go through the uh- drive through vehicle wash and she pays for that too. [Justin snorts] Um, and then I take her to have dinner with my family, and--

speaker: Travis
lines: Wait, like your wife and stuff?

speaker: Merle
lines: She meets my ex-wife; it does not-- [Travis laughs] it really kind of sucks, um, and then, uhh, she's having a miserable time and she's really mad, she can't wait to get outta there. I take her back to her house, and so I lean up against the door jam and say, 'Sure you don't want me to come in for a few minutes?' and she slams the door in my face.

speaker: Audience
lines: [exaggerated] Ooooooooooh!

speaker: Travis
lines: That's your ideal first date? Wait, hold on--[laughs]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Big round of applause from the audience at that one, [someone laughs] and Edward says,

speaker: Edward
lines: I love your honesty! Taako, another question! Say that you and our contestant are on a date, and one of your fans recognises you on the street. How do you respond to that situation?

speaker: Taako
lines: Well you know I really- My fans come first, so I would definitely sign whatever, pose for fantasy pictures, not fantasy pictures but fantasy pic-- you know, ‘cause there's not cameras? I don't mean like fantastical pictures, I just mean like whatever passes for a camera in this reality-

speaker: Clint
lines: I think it’s drawing, isn’t it?

speaker: Taako
lines: Drawing, yeah. If they wanna draw me like their French girls that’s fine. You know, I would just make sure the fan got what they were looking for, ‘cause they come first, I need everyone I can get at this point, honestly.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, it's absolutely silent in the studio. [laughs] And you see the silhouette cross its shadowy arms and kind of tap its foot from behind the sheet, and Edward says,

speaker: Edward
lines: Kind of an airball there, kind of a brick. That's okay, we'll get 'em on the next round.

speaker: Taako
lines: Great.

speaker: Edward
lines: Magnus, uh-

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah?

speaker: Edward
lines: Same question, say you and the contestant are on a date, and one of your fans recognises you on the street. How do you respond to that situation?

speaker: Magnus
lines: I have fans?

speaker: Edward
lines: Well, one of your heroic fans, sure!

speaker: Magnus
lines: Uh... I mean, I guess are they--what do they want-- What does the fan want? Are they just like, 'Hey Magnus!'

speaker: Edward
lines: Yeah- Yeah I don't- The question seemed pretty clear.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Well, but I mean, the interaction varies, ‘cause if they just want, like, a wave and “ah hey,” I keep going. If they want me to stop and, like, sign a chair or something, whittle them a small duck, um– that might be inconvenient based on my schedule. Do we have dinner reservations, are we trying to get somewhere in a certain amount of time? I need more-- There's a lot of parameters in every social interaction!

speaker: Griffin
lines: The audience seems--the audience is actually booing you now, Magnus.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Oh, okay. Um, I guess what I mean to say is… Since I was with my date first, they would take priority.

speaker: Griffin
lines: The audience is now whistling, and clapping, and laughing for you. They're overjoyed, and the silhouette is fanning itself again, the silhouette is feeling Magnus.

speaker: Travis
lines: I want you guys to know, I am both weirded out but my competitive streak is kind of taking over, and now I sort of wanna win. [Clint laughs]

speaker: Lydia
lines: Merle, new question. Why shouldn't the contestant choose your two competitors?

speaker: Merle
lines: Well, because um, I mean look at Magnus. I mean, even though he's in his forties, he's kept himself up. He's in magnificent shape, um, and, um, would– would not be a gentle lover-

speaker: Travis
lines: WHOA! WHOA-HO-HO! [laughter]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Jeezy creezy.

speaker: Justin
lines: I regret this entire podcast.

speaker: Merle
lines: So don’t-- Don't go with him-

speaker: Griffin
lines: This whole podcast has been a mistake up to- because of this-

speaker: Merle
lines: Taako is- Taako is, he's too much into his work. Always chopping, always salt, always making sauces, um, and you know, when he's not cooking, he's studying about cooking, so there wouldn't be any time left for– for you. Whereas I am so old. I only got one arm-

speaker: Griffin
lines: [imitating Merle] I don't have a lot going on right now.

speaker: Merle
lines: I don’t have a lot going on. I'll do nothing but, like, pay attention to ya.

speaker: Lydia
lines: Taako, same question, why shouldn't the contestant choose either of your competitors?

speaker: Taako
lines: Um... it’s me.

speaker: Taako
lines: Hi, I'm Taako…? You know, from T.V.?

speaker: Griffin
lines: There is such thunderous applause, and a chair actually comes fucking flying out from the audience and slides across the set, the audience is losing their mind, the silhouette does not seem as impressed.

speaker: Justin
lines: I cast Tasha's Hideous Laughter on the silhouette.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh... Uh-- [laughs] Fuckin’– shit, okay, what's that do?

speaker: Justin
lines: Creature of your choice that you can see within in range perceives everything as hilariously funny and falls into fits of laughter if the spell affects it, must succeed on a wisdom saving throw or fall prone becoming incapacitated, and unable to stand up for the duration. A creature with an intelligence score of four or less isn't affected.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um...okay, so I roll wisdom save?

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, wisdom save.

speaker: Griffin
lines: That's a nine.

speaker: Justin
lines: [audibly smiling] Nope.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, so, yeah, then this, ho- This is gonna get bad– uh, this shape from behind the curtain falls out of its chair, and as it does you see its head pop off, and it picks up its head and laughs at that, and now it's doubled over laughing at that, and now this shape behind the curtain is just sort of flailing around in laughter, in like, weird, like, inscrutable ways. And the audience sees this and is also laughing at this and-- Gang, the scene’s getting maybe a lil bit spooky.

speaker: Travis
lines: Magnus is suitably horrified.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Actually, the lights have started to lower a little bit, and the two elves turn to you, Magnus, and say,

speaker: Elves
lines: Magnus, what makes a good hero?

speaker: Justin
lines: I cast True Seeing on Magnus.

speaker: [“Wonderland
lines: Round One” begins to play]

speaker: Griffin
lines: What does that do?

speaker: Justin
lines: He can see things as they actually are for the duration, he has truesight, he sees the secret doors hidden by magic, and can see into the Ethereal Plane all out to a range of a 120ft.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, Magnus, you- You don't warn him then, right Taako?

speaker: Justin
lines: No, I can’t. I can’t take the risk.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright- Fucking, Magnus, suddenly and without explanation, you--your vision changes, and you can see the audience now through the lights, and it is just a bunch of these fairly intricately put together wooden marionettes, they are faceless, but otherwise they are detailed complete with fingers and joints on those fingers, and they are the ones sort of moving around and reacting to all of these scenes, you see--

speaker: Justin
lines: As he's looking around, I say,

speaker: Taako
lines: You know what? Fuck all of this. This fucking sucks. I'm done playing.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay then, shit- you see– Taako, you see a black cloud come out of your mouth as you say this.

speaker: Magnus, back to you, one other thing that you see is these two elves in their fancy jumpsuits--pantsuits rather, they don’t look like elves actually, with your current sight, they are both wearing black robes and they- you cannot really see their faces inside of this robe, you just sort of see a faint red light coming from within their hoods, and they have like semi-skeletal arms and a body underneath. And you recognise that they are liches, and you also see... standing, just sort of slightly in front of you, Magnus, you see that Red Robe, and it's the one that you've seen so many times now.

The one that confronted you after the big race in Petals to the Metal, the one that confronted you in the Cosmoscope in Lucas' lab. And he is standing there, and you see him sort of siphoning off that black cloud as Taako is sort of projecting it into the atmosphere, and the other two liches don't seem to see him; it seems like you are the only one that can see him with your truesight, and he looks over and realises that he can see you, and that you can see each other, and you just see this Red Robe put a single, skeletal finger, to its non-existent lips.
